Posts.Content: I have a terrific book for both you and your husband to read!  It's called 'The Breast Cancer Husband - How To Help Your Wife (And Yourself) Through Diagnosis, Treatment, and Beyond'  Author is Marc Silver.    You Will Get Through This!!
Posts.Title: not sure if I can fight this battle

Posts.Content: Linda, I just saw your post.  How are you?  Did you have your mamogram?  Hoping everything turned right for you! Barbara
Posts.Title: what's wrong with me?

Posts.Content: To ask that question is to be negative. Anyone's life expectency is until they take their last breath. You could be hit by a bus tomorrow. I had a friend who went to Mexico. She died 6 months later. She went holistic refusing chemo. We all begged her not to go that way, that cancer cells are extremely smart and cunning.
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: To ask that question is to be negative. Anyone's life expectency is until they take their last breath. You could be hit by a bus tomorrow. I had a friend who went to Mexico. She died 6 months later. She went holistic refusing chemo. We all begged her not to go that way, that cancer cells are extremely smart and cunning.
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: Hi Smitten!  I had a similar experince as yours. Found a tumor, left breast extremely close to the chest wall.  Had surgery then the Onco test which came back pretty bad.  A month later found it spread to my liver.  After a few days of asking "why me" I figured I better get myself together and start fighting.  Started chemo (Taxotere only) and my hair only thinned out on the top.  It was still a shock though & I didn't know whether to laugh or cry as I stood there in the shower holding a handfull of hair.  My husband pulled out the clippers and I have had a buzz cut ever since and I have to say I like it!!  It is so darn convenient to slip on a wig when I go to work.   Last treatment was 5/27 and we can see that it is growing back.  My lashes really thinned which I miss more then anything else.  But I feel good and I'm alive and I know I'm not alone in this battle.\ Keep a real good attitude, laugh alot and remember that this is only temporary!  Enjoy the day!  Barbara
Posts.Title: Newbie here.....

Posts.Content: Hi.  I was being treated w/Faslodex.  Breast cancer w/mets to liver.  I had 6 rounds of Taxotere 1st, then 6 shots of Faslodex.  The liver tumors are resolving which is great, but I'm now back on chemo since the cancer has spread to the lymph nodes.   Hang in there and good luck! Barbara
Posts.Title: Faslodex??

Posts.Content: Hi Cocopuff! I am also stage 4 metastatic triple negative! Not many of us out there to talk to. I just started Xeloda. Just ended my 2nd week. Befor this I was on Halaven which is only a shot. It worked great for 3.5 years. How long have you been on Xeloda?
Posts.Title: Oral Drugs That Have Worked

Posts.Content: I am a metalifer. I will live until I want to. So can she. A cure can happen tomorrow. Tell her not to give up ever. I should have been gone by May 2012 but i am still here and don't plan on leaving yet.
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body

Posts.Content: Dear Lena, so sorry about your mom.  I have been a stage 4 breast cancer w/mets to liver and lymph nodes.  Had Taxotere and some other chemo but started a clinical trial which has now been approved for lung and breast cancer patients.  It is called Halaven and has been working for me for almost 2 years now.  Your mom may want to try it.  It was formeraly called Eruoblin. Barbara
Posts.Title: Seeking advice stage 4 running out of options

Posts.Content: Kathy, just think and look at it as your badge of courage!! That's what I did along with a fantastic wig. Smile. Always smile.
Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Content: Kathy, just think and look at it as your badge of courage!! That's what I did along with a fantastic wig. Smile. Always smile.
